articles.headline: Tesla Value Hits $100 Billion. Will Elon Musk Get a Big Bonus?
articles.snippet: The chief executive could get a stock award worth hundreds of millions if the carmaker’s market capitalization is sustained in the months ahead.
articles.abstract: The chief executive could get a stock award worth hundreds of millions if the carmaker’s market capitalization is sustained in the months ahead.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tesla’s share price hit a record high on Wednesday, surpassing a threshold that could ultimately unlock hundreds of millions of dollars in bonus compensation for its chief executive, Elon Musk.

articles.headline: In Impeachment Case, Schiff Accuses Trump of Trying ‘to Cheat’ in Election
articles.snippet: The House impeachment managers began presenting their oral arguments against President Trump in the Senate trial, arguing that his conduct warranted his removal.
articles.abstract: The House impeachment managers began presenting their oral arguments against President Trump in the Senate trial, arguing that his conduct warranted his removal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House Democratic impeachment managers began formal arguments in the Senate trial on Wednesday, presenting a meticulous and scathing case for convicting President Trump and removing him from office on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

articles.headline: How Jeff Bezos’ iPhone X Was Hacked
articles.snippet: It most likely began with a tiny bit of code that implanted malware, which gave attackers access to Mr. Bezos’ photos and texts.
articles.abstract: It most likely began with a tiny bit of code that implanted malware, which gave attackers access to Mr. Bezos’ photos and texts.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — On the afternoon of May 1, 2018, Jeff Bezos received a message on WhatsApp from an account belonging to Saudi Arabia’s crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman.

articles.headline: Stuck in the Senate as Their 2020 Rivals Have Iowa to Themselves
articles.snippet: Several Democratic candidates and top contenders in the Feb. 3 caucuses are at the impeachment trial while Joe Biden and Pete Buttigieg court hundreds of voters each day.
articles.abstract: Several Democratic candidates and top contenders in the Feb. 3 caucuses are at the impeachment trial while Joe Biden and Pete Buttigieg court hundreds of voters each day.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hours into the first long night of President Trump’s impeachment trial on Tuesday, Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont kept checking his watch. Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts sipped hot water — one of two drinks allowed in the chamber — to warm up. Senator Amy Klobuchar of Minnesota jotted down notes. And Senator Michael Bennet of Colorado stood and listened.

articles.headline: Twitter Tells Facial Recognition Trailblazer to Stop Using Site’s Photos
articles.snippet: Twitter said Clearview AI, whose app is spreading in law enforcement, was violating its policies. Lawmakers also expressed privacy concerns.
articles.abstract: Twitter said Clearview AI, whose app is spreading in law enforcement, was violating its policies. Lawmakers also expressed privacy concerns.
articles.lead_paragraph: A mysterious company that has licensed its powerful facial recognition technology to hundreds of law enforcement agencies is facing attacks from Capitol Hill and from at least one Silicon Valley giant.

articles.headline: Two Legal Teams With Contrasting Strategies Face Off in the Capitol
articles.snippet: As House impeachment managers emphasize the facts, President Trump’s defense team calls the process unfair.
articles.abstract: As House impeachment managers emphasize the facts, President Trump’s defense team calls the process unfair.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Trump’s impeachment trial opened this week, the Democratic House managers prosecuting the case piled their table high with binders and notepads. Only a few rested on the defense table.

articles.headline: People Are Calling SWAT Teams to Tech Executives’ Homes
articles.snippet: Online forums carry personal details of potential targets like industry leaders and their families. The police are struggling to find a solution.
articles.abstract: Online forums carry personal details of potential targets like industry leaders and their families. The police are struggling to find a solution.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Over the first week of November, the police in San Francisco and New York responded to a series of telephone calls claiming that hostages were being held in the homes of Adam Mosseri, a senior Facebook executive.

articles.headline: They Changed the Way You Buy Your Basics
articles.snippet: Founders of Dollar Shave Club, Warby Parker and other billion-dollar companies exploited giant rivals’ weaknesses — and really listened to their customers.
articles.abstract: Founders of Dollar Shave Club, Warby Parker and other billion-dollar companies exploited giant rivals’ weaknesses — and really listened to their customers.
articles.lead_paragraph: At 6:15 in the morning on March 6, 2012, Michael Dubin woke up and checked his computer. He was puzzled by what he saw — actually, by what he didn’t see. Before going to bed, he had posted a video about his start-up, a company that virtually no one had ever heard of.

articles.headline: How China’s Virus Outbreak Could Threaten the Global Economy
articles.snippet: Markets have tumbled as investors worry that Chinese shoppers will stay home for the Lunar New Year holiday and beyond. Economists say the possible impact isn’t yet clear.
articles.abstract: Markets have tumbled as investors worry that Chinese shoppers will stay home for the Lunar New Year holiday and beyond. Economists say the possible impact isn’t yet clear.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The outbreak of a deadly disease in China has cast a pall over growth prospects for the world’s second largest economy, raising fears about the global outlook if the mysterious coronavirus spreads or worsens.
